The '85th Academy Awards ceremony' (referred to as 'The Oscars' ), presented by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences
(AMPAS), honored the best films of 2012 and took place February 24, 2013, at the
Dolby Theatre in Hollywood, Los Angeles beginning at 5:30 p.m. PST / 8:30 p.m.
EST. During the ceremony, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and
Sciences presented Academy Awards (commonly referred to as 'Oscars') in 24
categories. The ceremony was televised in the United States by ABC. Actor Seth
MacFarlane hosted the Academy Awards for the first time.

In related events, the Academy held its second Annual Governors Awards ceremony
at the Grand Ballroom of the Hollywood and Highland Center on December 1,
2012. On February 9, 2013, in a ceremony at The Beverly Hills Hotel
in Beverly Hills, the Academy Awards for Technical Achievement were presented by
hosts Chris Pine and Zoe Saldana.

[[Life of Pi (film)|Life of Pi]] won four awards including Best Director for Ang
Lee. [[Argo (2012 film)|Argo]] won three awards, including Best
Picture, the third film to win an Academy Award for Best Picture without its
director nominated. [[Les MisÃ©rables (2012 film)|Les
MisÃ©rables]] also won three awards. [[Django Unchained]], [[Lincoln (2012
film)|Lincoln]] and [[Skyfall]] won two awards each. Other winners were [[Silver
Linings Playbook]], [[Brave (2012 film)|Brave]], [[Zero Dark Thirty]], [[Anna
Karenina (2012 film)|Anna Karenina]], [[Searching for Sugar Man]], [[Inocente]],
[[Curfew (2012 film)|Curfew]], [[Amour (2012 film)|Amour]], and [[Paperman]]
with one award each. Jennifer Lawrence won the Best Actress award for her role
in Silver Linings Playbook, becoming, at age 22, the second youngest winner in
the category. Daniel Day-Lewis won a third Best Actor award
(the most for any actor) for portraying the titular character in
Lincoln. {{cite web|url= http://www.guardian.co.uk/film/2013/feb/25/oscars-2013-
live |title= Oscars 2013 awards ceremony â as it happened|date=February 25,
2013|work=Guardian UK|accessdate=February 25, 2013 }} {{cite web|url=
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2284066/Seth-MacFarlane-strikes-
chord-critics-jabs-women-weight-compares-Ben-Affleck-Kardashians.html |title=
Oscars presenter Seth MacFarlane hits a bum note with jokes about Adele's
weight, actresses boobs, and 'Chris and Rihanna's date movie'... Django
Unchained |date=February 25, 2013|work=Daily Mail|accessdate=February 25, 2013
}} As co-producer of the Best Picture winner, George Clooney
became the third person (after Michael Douglas and Laurence Olivier) to win
Oscars for both acting and producing.

This was the first Academy Awards ceremony in eight years where the winner of
Best Picture didn't either win the highest amount of awards or tie with another
film for the highest amount of awards, the previous case being [[Million Dollar
Baby]] in 2005.

The telecast garnered about 40 million viewers (in North America).
headings: Films with multiple nominations and awards
